fields.summary: Instances stuck in shutting-down state in vmware

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I attempted to launch several instances from an unconverted PV EMI in 2 different clusters (kvm + vmware) while the imaging service was disabled. I attempted to terminate 1 instance from each cluster. The KVM cluster's instance went to terminated shortly after the request. The vmware cluster's instance(s) seems to be stuck in 'shutting-down' state and occupying resources. 
Log snippets below. 
Thanks, -M

CLC cloud-output...
{code}
[root@c-32 eucalyptus]# grep i-931af835 cloud-output.log*

fields.summary: Instances launched while imaging service is disabled can not be terminated
fields.environment:
GIT_REPO	git+ssh://repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com/internal#testing

comments.body: A possible workaround is to restart the VMware broker.
This ticket relates to VMware. See https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/iaas/compatibility for latest hypervisor compatibility by version.
